Microsoft is reportedly working on software that would make Windows PCs compatible with its Kinect hands-free motion controller, which at present works only with the Xbox 360 gaming console. WinRumors said Microsoft would release the utilities in the coming months. The company has not confirmed the report. It's not the first time reports of Kinect software for Windows PCs have surfaced.
